Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How did your week go with the goals we set last time?
Hi, Ellie! It was okay. I managed to watch a couple of episodes, but I didn’t get around to crocheting.
That’s alright! Watching your favorite show is a positive step. What did you enjoy most about the episodes you watched?
I really liked the humor. It made me laugh, which felt good.
Laughter can be such a powerful tool. I’m glad it brought you some joy. What do you think stopped you from crocheting?
I don’t know. I just kept thinking about how I didn’t have the energy to start.
That’s understandable. Sometimes just starting can feel like a big hurdle. Would it help if we set a very small goal for crocheting, like just picking up the yarn for a few minutes?
Yeah, I think I could do that. Just picking it up seems easier.
Absolutely! It’s all about making it manageable. Let’s also check in on how you’ve been feeling emotionally this week. Have there been any ups and downs?
Mostly downs, to be honest. I still feel really tired and unmotivated.
I’m sorry to hear that. It sounds like you’re still carrying a lot of emotional weight. Have there been any specific triggers for those feelings?
Just the usual money worries and feeling alone, I guess.
Those feelings can be really heavy. It’s okay to acknowledge that. Have you had any support from friends or family this week?
Not really. I don’t have many people to talk to about this stuff.
That can be tough. Sometimes just having someone to talk to can help lighten the load a bit. Would you be open to exploring ways to connect with others, even if it’s just online or through a group?
I might consider that. I just don’t know where to start.
That’s okay! We can explore some options together. There are online forums and support groups where people share similar experiences. It could be a safe space for you to connect with others.
That sounds interesting. I’ll think about it.
Great! It’s all about finding what feels right for you. Let’s also revisit the financial stress. Have you had a chance to look at your expenses more closely?
I did a little bit. I wrote down my essentials, but I’m still worried about how to manage everything.
That’s a great start! Acknowledging your expenses is an important step. Would it help if we brainstormed some potential ways to increase your income or cut back on non-essential expenses?
Yeah, I think that could help. I just feel stuck.
I understand. Let’s take it one step at a time. What are some skills or talents you have that could potentially be turned into a side gig?
Well, I’m good at makeup and hair. I could maybe do some freelance work.
That’s a fantastic idea! Freelancing could not only provide some extra income but also help you connect with others. Would you be willing to explore that option?
I could look into it. It sounds more appealing than I thought.

That’s the spirit! It’s all about taking small steps that can lead to bigger changes. Let’s also set a couple of goals for this week. Perhaps you can try crocheting for a few minutes and researching freelance opportunities?
Yeah, I can do that.
Perfect! I’m excited to hear how it goes. Remember, it’s about progress, not perfection. You’re doing well by just showing up and being open.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! Take care of yourself, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
